attributes.action: different antenatal wards for women who have miscarriages in Scotland
attributes.additional_details: We need separate wards and specifically trained staff for women what suffer the loss of a child at any stage of pregnancy, the emotional and physical anguish is very difficult to cope with but can be unbearable if this has happened to you and you are put in a ward with women who have made the choice to have an abortion for non medical reasons and also women who are nursing their new born babies, also staff who are treating these women should have adequate training to help the woman and partner with the physical and emotional trauma of losing a baby at any stage and aftercare such as follow up or emotional support should be in a separate department from the antenatal unit
